ingredients: Lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles, ketchup, and mustard for serving
directions: Preheat grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
In a large bowl, mix together ground beef, salt, and black pepper. Form into 4 equal patties.
Grill patties for 4-5 minutes per side, until fully cooked. During the last minute of cooking, top each patty with a slice of cheese.
Serve burgers on toasted buns with desired toppings.
In a large bowl, whisk together buttermilk and hot sauce. Add chicken pieces and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or up to overnight.
In a shallow dish, whisk together flour, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and black pepper.
Remove chicken from buttermilk mixture, allowing excess to drip off. Dredge chicken in flour mixture, pressing to adhere.
Heat about 1 inch of vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Working in batches, fry chicken until golden brown and fully cooked, about 6-8 minutes per side.
Transfer chicken to a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil. Serve hot.
Cook macaroni according to package directions, until al dente. Drain and set aside.
In a large saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Whisk in flour and cook for 1-2 minutes, until mixture is smooth and bubbly.
Gradually whisk in milk and heavy cream, stirring constantly, until mixture comes to a simmer and thickens slightly. Stir in salt and black pepper.
Remove from heat and stir in cheddar and Parmesan cheeses until melted and smooth.
Stir in cooked macaroni until well coated with cheese sauce. Transfer mixture to a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
